chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Patricia Nicole Kaarto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Patricia Nicole Kaarto is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Patricia Nicole Kaarto was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Patricia Nicole Kaarto was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patricia Nicole Kaarto

records.addlTxt:
3:24 PM Defendant Patricia Nicole Kaarto in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Patricia Nicole Kaarto.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement that 21CT135 be dismissed. In 20CF479, defendant enter into a DJOC for a period of 5 years and conditions include pay restitution in amount of $10,526.61 joint and several with codefendant 20CF478, Christopher Hayward. In 22CF94, defendant to plead to count 1 and amended Count 2 - Misdemeanor bail jumping 946.49(1)(a) and in 22CF241, plead to Count 1 and amended Count 2 - 961.41(3g)(d) - Misdemeanor Possession of Amphetamine. Counts 3 and 4 to be dismissed. In 22CF94, for Count 1 and amended Count 2 - withheld sentence for 2 years probation. Conditions of probation of pay mandatory court costs, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, no contact with Menards and serve 48 days jail with credit for 48 days. Probation concurrent to 22CF241 and concurrent jail. In 22CF241, for Count 1 and amended Count 2, withheld sentence for 2 years probation. Conditions of probation of pay mandatory court costs, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and serve 32 days jail with credit for 32 days. Defendant pleads no contest to each count. Attorney Hoffman stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. In 20CF479, the Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is deferred pursuant to the terms of the agreement. Defendant unsure she would be able to make monthly payment as outlined in the DJOC. Court reviews payment options with defendant. Defendant states she would be able to post minimum of $75 a month. State will monitor status of restitution being paid and if need be a hearing to be held. 

Court imposes for 22CF94, for Count 1 and amended Count 2 - withheld sentence for 2 years probation. Conditions of probation of pay mandatory court costs, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, no contact with Menards and serve 48 days jail with credit for 48 days. Probation concurrent to 22CF241 and concurrent jail. In 22CF241, for Count 1 and amended Count 2, withheld sentence for 2 years probation. Conditions of probation of pay mandatory court costs, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and serve 32 days jail with credit for 32 days. Bail to be applied to restitution.

3:08 PM Defendant Patricia Nicole Kaarto appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Chad La Lor for Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Patricia Nicole Kaarto. Attorney Hoffman notes defendant is a lifelong resident. States defendant is unable to post cash bond. Attorney Hoffman states defendant struggling with incarceration and asks for reduction to signature bond. Defendant makes a statement. State is opposed to bail modification and has not seen any documentation to defendant's stated medical issues. State reviews defendant's four pending open cases in Douglas County. Does not see any fta's but continues to commit offenses while on bail. Court reviews bail jumping charges and not following court orders. Court denies bail modification.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Court finds probable cause for bind over, sets new date along with prior files

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Angela M Wilson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Patricia Nicole Kaarto appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Patricia Nicole Kaarto. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $750 cash. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Indicates that the defendant is currently out on bail in other pending files in this county. Recites defendant's criminal history, notes no FTAs in any files. Attorney Reid indicates that the defendant is a lifelong local resident and notes no FTAs in any files. Asks for signature bond or $250 cash bond.

Court notes concerns over other open cases. Court orders $500 cash. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
